name: Friday the 13th
content:
Given two dates, determine the number of Friday the 13ths between them, inclusive. Leap years are included; in a leap year, an extra day is added to February. The rules for which years are leap years are:
  • Every year that is a multiple of four, except
  • Every year that is a multiple of one hundred, except
  • Every year that is a multiple of four hundred.
For example, the year 1900 would not be a leap year, but 2000 would because it is a multiple of four hundred.

The number of days in each month is:
  • January, March, May, July, August, October, December: 31 days
  • April, June, September, November: 30 days
  • February: 28 days, except on leap years
input: The input will consist of two lines, each of which contains a date in the format Weekday, Month DD, YYYY. The year will be at least 1000, and the dates will be no more than 500 years apart.
output: Output one number: the number of Friday the 13ths between the two dates, inclusive.
